findings.title: ST - Stop Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop the sales for all users excluding the owner. The owner may take advantage of it by setting the maxSellTransactionAmount to zero.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceed Limit Fees Manipulation
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25% by calling the `setMarketingFee` function with a high percentage value.

findings.title: L01 - Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: There are segments that contain unused state variables.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code elimination is necessary to remove unreachable or redundant code.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Variables defined in local scope are not initialized.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: There are variables that are defined in the local scope and are not initialized.
